data.name: ApplyRoles.Text
data.value: Helps you quickly apply "Edit" and "View" permissions to all pages in a specific portal for a given role. You can use the --portalId and --roleName parameters to define the portal and role, ensuring consistent role assignments across all pages. If any parameters are missing, defaults will be applied based on the portal configuration.

data.name: CaptchaModeToggled.Text
data.value: CAPTCHA has been toggled {0} on this website.

data.name: CompressLogFiles.Text
data.value:
This command compresses and archives log files from the previous month in the /Portals/_default/Logs/ directory. The logs are saved in a zip file named Logs-YYYYmm.zip, where YYYY is the year and mm is the month. It only includes logs from the current and previous month. It also includes complementary logs, like installation and failure logs, and deletes the failure logs after archiving them.
Additionally, the command supports the -scheduler option to manage the scheduled job execution:
enable: Checks if the scheduled job exists. If not, it creates and enables it. disable: Disables the scheduled job if it exists. If it doesn’t exist, it creates it but keeps it disabled.

data.name: CompressLogFilesRunnerFailure.Text
data.value: Compress Log Files Runner Failure

data.name: PromptDeletePackages.Text
data.value: This prompt command will allow you to delete all of the saved packages in the `/App_Code/ExtensionPackages/` folder. This should only be done with websites that do not have any plans of using the website import/export features.

data.name: PromptDeleteTempFolder.Text
data.value: Running this command will delete the `/Install/Temp/` folder in your DNN website. This can help diagnose/prevent extension installation issues in some cases.

data.name: PromptListAvailablePackages.Text
data.value: When you use this command, you will be shown a listing of all of the available packages that could be installed directly from the website itself.

data.name: PromptListPackages.Text
data.value: This command allows you to list and see the extension packages that have been saved in the `/App_Data/ExtensionPackages/` folder.

data.name: PromptPopupMode.Text
data.value: Allows you to enable/disable the popup editing feature on the current website or all sites in this installation.

data.name: PromptThemeseUsed.Text
data.value: This command allows you to see all of the themes that currently are used by one or more pages, modules, and other settings.

data.name: Prompt_AddRoleSuccess.Text
data.value: Successfully role: {0} added to all tabs in Portal {1}.

data.name: Prompt_ApplyRoles_ResultHtml.Text
data.value:
This command is used to assign "Edit" and "View" permissions to all pages in a specified portal for a given role. It's useful for ensuring consistent permissions across all pages of the portal.

Help_Options

Flag Type Required Default Description
--portalId Integer Yes 0 The --portalId flag specifies the portal ID where the roles will be applied.
--roleName String Yes Site Admin The --roleName flag specifies the name of the role to which permissions will be applied.

Using apply-roles

apply-roles --portalId 1 --roleName "Site Admin"

Output

If successful, you will see a confirmation message for each page, indicating that the permissions were applied correctly.

Role Applied:

Successfully applied "Site Admin" role to all pages in portal 1.

Error Applying Role:

Error applying role "Site Admin" in portal 1.

data.name: Prompt_CaptchaMode_ResultHtml.Text
data.value:
This command makes it super-simple to toggle the login CAPTCHA setting on and off.

WARNING! When used, this command will clear the data cache on your website. Though, most people will likely not notice, some page loads may be a bit slower for the next few moments.

Using set-captcha

set-captcha

This command does not have any options.

When you run this command, CAPTCHA mode is toggled in the Site Settings. If the setting doesn't already exist, it creates it.

data.name: Prompt_CompressLogFilesRunnerSuccess.Text
data.value: Log compression job executed successfully.

data.name: Prompt_CompressLogFiles_ResultHtml.Text
data.value:
Help_Options

Flag Type Required Default Description
--scheduler String No None Manages the scheduled job execution. Accepts the following values:
  • enable - Checks if the scheduled job exists. If not, it creates and enables it.
  • disable - Disables the scheduled job if it exists. If it doesn’t exist, it creates it but keeps it disabled.

Using compress-log-files

compress-log-files compress-log-files --scheduler enable compress-log-files --scheduler disable

Output

If successful, you will see a confirmation message indicating that the logs have been compressed and archived.

Compression Successful:

Logs for the previous month have been compressed and saved in Logs-YYYYmm.zip.

Scheduler Enabled:

Scheduled job successfully enabled.

Scheduler Disabled:

Scheduled job successfully disabled.

data.name: Prompt_DebugInfo_ResultHtml.Text
data.value:
Helps you see and know where debugging might already be turned on. This is helpful when you're not sure or have multiple people working on a site.

Toggle whether the site is in debug mode, or running normally

list-debug

This command does not have any options.

If you find that one or more areas have debug turned on, you should use the command below to disable debug mode. You may need to run it twice.

set-debug

data.name: Prompt_DebugMode_ResultHtml.Text
data.value:
When you need more information to help diagnose and resolve an error, this command can help you get more verbose and detailed information.

WARNING! When used, this command will RESTART your website. Page loads for the next few moments after running this command will be slower.

Using set-debug

set-debug

This command does not have any options.

When you run this command, debug mode is toggled in the superuser settings, web.config, and the DotNetNuke.log4net.config files.

If you're unsure if you need to run this command, first try running the command below.

list-debug

data.name: Prompt_DeleteDemoUsers_ResultHtml.Text
data.value:
This is a companion command for the `set-demousers` command. This version of the command will permanently delete the users accounts created by that command.

Using delete-demousers

delete-demousers

This command does not have any flags

delete-demousers

Output

If successful, you should see a message for each demo user deleted, stating the result of the deletion of the account.

User Deleted:

Successfully deleted user account: Jane Doe ({jdoe@example.com}).

User Doesn't Exist:

User account does not exist, not deleted: Jane Doe ({jdoe@example.com}).

data.name: Prompt_DeletePackages_ResultHtml.Text
data.value:
Newer versions of DNN saves any installed extension into the `/App_Data/ExtensionPackages/` folder. This command allows you to delete those files to save disk space.

Using delete-packages

delete-packages

This command does not have any flags

delete-packages

Output

If completely successful, you will see a single message similar to that seen below (the numbers will be different for everyone).

Successfully deleted 41 of 41 files in the `/App_Data/ExtensionPackages/` folder.

If one or more errors are found, a listing of each errored file will be shown, including the messages below.

Error Deleting; (file name here) Successfully deleted 38 of 41 files in the `/App_Data/ExtensionPackages/` folder.

The example above assumes that 3 files were unable to be deleted. When this happens, sometimes the file is locked and the command can simply be run again.

data.name: Prompt_DeleteTempFolder_ResultHtml.Text
data.value:
Everytime you install/upgrade an extension in DNN, a temporary folder is created in the `/Install/Temp/` directory in your website. This command allows you to quickly delete that folder and everything to help you keep your DNN instance clean.

Using delete-tempfolder

delete-tempfolder

This command does not have any flags

delete-tempfolder

Output

If completely successful, you will see a single message similar to that seen below.

The files and folders in the installation temporary folder have been deleted.

If one or more errors are found, a listing of each errored file will be shown, including the messages below.

data.name: Prompt_DeleteTestUsers_ResultHtml.Text
data.value:
This is a companion command for the `set-testusers` command. This version of the command will permanently delete the users accounts created by that command.

Using delete-testusers

delete-testusers

This command does not have any flags

delete-testusers

Output

If successful, you should see a message for each test user deleted, stating the result of the deletion of the account.

User Deleted:

Successfully deleted user account: testuser-1 ({testuser-1@example.com}).

User Doesn't Exist:

User account does not exist, not deleted: testuser-1 ({testuser-1@example.com}).

data.name: Prompt_DemoUsers_ResultHtml.Text
data.value:
When working on building a website or extension, you often need some demo users to use for your work. This command adds a handful of test user accounts for you.

Using set-demousers

set-demousers

This command does not have any flags

set-demousers

Output

If successful, you should see a message for each demo user, stating the result of the creation of the account.

User Created:

Successfully created user: Jane Doe ({jdoe@example.com}).

User Exists:

User already exists, not created: Jane Doe ({jdoe@example.com}).

Error Creating User:

Error creating user: Jane Doe ({jdoe@example.com}).

(if this happens, check the Admin Log to see why, or run `set-debug` and then check the Log4NET log file for more details.)

data.name: Prompt_ImpersonateFlagsInvalid.Text
data.value: You must either specify a valid UserID -OR- Username value to impersonate another user account. Both were empty. Please only specify one.

data.name: Prompt_ImpersonateNotAuthorized.Text
data.value: This user account is not authorized to perform this action.

data.name: Prompt_ImpersonateNoUserFound.Text
data.value: No user account was found matching your query. Please check the UserID or Username you entered for accuracy and try again.

data.name: Prompt_ImpersonateSuccess.Text
data.value: Impersonation was successful. Please refresh the page.

data.name: Prompt_Impersonate_FlagPortalID.Text
data.value: The `portalid` flag allows you to target a single website by entering the correct PortalID value (Site ID number). This flag should be used by itself.

data.name: Prompt_Impersonate_FlagUserID.Text
data.value: The `userid` flag allows you to target a user account by entering a valid UserID. This flag should be used by itself.

data.name: Prompt_Impersonate_FlagUsername.Text
data.value: The `username` flag allows you to specify a user account to impersonate by entering their username. This flag should be used by itself.

data.name: Prompt_Impersonate_ResultHtml.Text
data.value:
Impersonation is a userful tool to use to help diagnose and troubleshoot issues on a website. This command allows you to do this. After running this command, you will be redirected to the website homepage, but logged in as the user account you specified. This may or may not work with non-DNN authentication providers.

Using impersonate

impersonate

This command has two flags that you need to be aware of. The `username` must be a string value that exactly matches a valid username on the same site (portal). The `userid` must also be a valid UserID, on the same site (portal).

Example using the `username` flag:

impersonate --username supersecretusername

Example using the `userid` flag:

impersonate --userid 1234

Output

If successful, you will see the message below and a log entry will be added to the event log (a.k.a., Admin Logs).

Impersonation was successful. Please refresh the page.

data.name: Prompt_ListAvailablePackages_ResultHtml.Text
data.value:
Some DNN websites may have extension packages sitting in the `/Install/` folders, waiting to be installed. This can greatly impact any DNN upgrade, if you're not aware of the packages. This command allows you to see if this is the case on your instance, and where they are.

This routine ignores any packages that won't automatically install. For example, it looks for installation packages ending with .zip and not .resources.

Using list-availablepackages

list-availablepackages

This command does not have any flags

list-availablepackages

Output

If successful, you will see an alphabetized listing of the available packages found in that folder, along with a message stating that there were records found or not.

Records Found:

Library has one or more available packages to review: C:\Work\Platform\platform9102\Website\Install\Library
Module has one or more available packages to review: C:\Work\Platform\platform9102\Website\Install\Module
Maches were found for your query.

No Records Found:

No matches were found for your query.

data.name: Prompt_ListPackages_ResultHtml.Text
data.value:
Newer versions of DNN saves any installed extension into the `/App_Data/ExtensionPackages/` folder. This is meant to be used with the site import/export feature. Using this command will allow you to view the files in that folder in alphabetical order.

Using list-packages

list-packages

This command does not have any flags

list-packages

Output

If successful, you will see an alphabetized listing of the packages found in that folder, along with a message stating that there were records found or not.

Records Found:

Maches were found for your query.

No Records Found:

No matches were found for your query.

data.name: Prompt_ModeInvalid.Text
data.value: The mode can only be 'enable' or 'disable'. The default is 'disable'.

data.name: Prompt_PasswordResetNoPortalFound.Text
data.value: No website was found matching your query. Please check the PortalID entered for accuracy and try again.

data.name: Prompt_PasswordResetNoRoleFound.Text
data.value: No security role was found matching your query. Please check the RoleID entered for accuracy and try again.

data.name: Prompt_PasswordResetNoUserFound.Text
data.value: No user account was found matching your query. Please check the UserID entered for accuracy and try again.

data.name: Prompt_PasswordsResetted.Text
data.value: {0} has chosen to require changed password(s) for: Scope ({1}), UserID ({2}), RoleID ({3}), PortalID ({4}).

data.name: Prompt_PopupMode_FlagScope.Text
data.value: Specify whether you want to apply this action to only the current site, or all sites. The accepted values include 'current' and 'all'.

data.name: Prompt_PopupMode_ResultHtml.Text
data.value:
Enable or disable popups on the current or all sites

set-popups [--mode <enable|disable>] [--scope <current|all>]

Popups have been [enabled/disabled] for [this site/all sites].

Note: If you don't enter any command arguments, you'll simply disable popups on the current website only.

data.name: Prompt_ResetPasswordNotAuthorized.Text
data.value: This user account is not authorized to perform this action.

data.name: Prompt_ResetPassword_ResultHtml.Text
data.value:
Resets the Password for One or Many User Accounts

password-reset [--scope <current|all>] [--userid <integer>] [--roleid <integer>] [--portalid <integer>]

Your request to reset the password for the specified user accounts was successful. Each user account will be prompted to change their password the next time they log in.

data.name: Prompt_SchedulerDisabled.Text
data.value: Scheduler disabled successfully.

data.name: Prompt_SchedulerEnabled.Text
data.value: Scheduler enabled successfully.

data.name: Prompt_SchedulerNotFound.Text
data.value: Scheduler not found.

data.name: Prompt_ScopeInvalid.Text
data.value: The scope can only be 'all' or 'current'. Omitting it will default to 'current'.

data.name: Prompt_TestUsers_ResultHtml.Text
data.value:
When working on building a website or extension, you often need some test users to use for your work. This command adds a handful of test user accounts for you.

Help_Options

FlagTypeRequiredDefaultDescription
--howmanyIntegerThe --howmany flag is to define how many users you want to create, otherwise 100 will be created by default.

Using set-testusers

set-testusers

Output

If successful, you should see a message for each test user, stating the result of the creation of the account.

User Created:

Successfully created user: testuser-1 ({testuser-1@example.com}).

User Exists:

User already exists, not created: testuser-1 ({testuser-1@example.com}).

Error Creating User:

Error creating user: testuser-1 ({testuser-1@example.com}).

(if this happens, check the Admin Log to see why, or run `set-debug` and then check the Log4NET log file for more details.)

data.name: Prompt_ThemesUsed_ResultHtml.Text
data.value:
Ideally, this list should be as short as possible on most websites.

View all of the theme settings used on the entire DNN instance

Using list-themes

list-themes

A listing of all of the themes that have been specified in the superuser settings, site settings, pages, and modules will be listed.

data.name: Prompt_DisableAdminMessage_ResultHtml.Text
data.value:
The `disable-adminmessage` command allows you to disable the DNN admin message feature across all modules of the site. This is particularly useful for developers and testers who want to avoid distractions caused by admin messages.

Using disable-adminmessage

disable-adminmessage

This command does not require any flags or parameters.

Output

If completely successful, you will see a message similar to the one below, indicating how many modules were updated:

Successfully updated 100 modules to hide the admin message.

If no updates were needed, you will see the following message:

Successfully updated 0 modules to hide the admin message.

This command works by checking each module for the presence of the `hideadminborder` setting in `ModuleSettings`. If the setting is not present or is not set to `True`, it will update the module with the correct value.

data.name: Prompt_UserImpersonated.Text
data.value: {0} has chosen to impersonate {1}.

data.name: RecordsNone.Text
data.value: No matches were found for your query.

data.name: RecordsSome.Text
data.value: Matches were found for your query.

data.name: ResetPassword.Text
data.value: Allows authorized user accounts to reset the password for one or many user accounts on the DNN instance.

data.name: ResetPasswordFlagsInvalid.Text
data.value: The scope can only be 'all' or 'current'. If you want to use the other parameters, please choose only one to use at a time (e.g., UserID, RoleID, PortalID).

data.name: ResetPasswordSuccess.Text
data.value: Your request to reset the password for the specified user accounts was successful. Each user account will be prompted to change their password the next time they log in.

data.name: ScopeAll.Text
data.value: all sites

data.name: ScopeCurrent.Text
data.value: the current site only

data.name: StateOff.Text
data.value: OFF

data.name: StateOn.Text
data.value: ON

data.name: TempFolderFilesDeleteSuccess.Text
data.value: The files and folders in the installation temporary folder have been deleted.

data.name: TestUserAccountsAdded.Text
data.value: Successfully added test user accounts with password: {0}... We saved some time together. Yay! :)

data.name: TestUsers.Text
data.value: Helps you develop or create demos by automatically adding a bunch of fun user accounts to play with. You can add the --howmany parameter to define how many users you want to create, otherwise 100 will be created by default.

data.name: TestUsersDeleted.Text

data.value: Thank you for using Upendo Prompt. There is no reason to place this module on a page at this time, but it may be necessary in the future.
